repnme.cdata!:
Belarus - Ozone Depleting Substances
            Phaseout Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and institutional
            development impacts substantial. Some of the many lessons
            convey that: 1) although the financial viability of
            beneficiary enterprises, is difficult to predict, a good
            monitoring system, such as the one established under the
            project, does help maintain a dialogue on the subject, and
            further investor confidence; 2) combining the Ozone
            Depleting Substances (ODS) phase-out investments, with
            legislative controls to discourage the use of ODS (a
            consumption tax), proved to be an effective experience,
            resulting in a cooperative relationship between the Ministry
            of Natural Resources, and the participating enterprises; 3)
            while the establishment of procurement, and financial
            management capacity at the start of a project is critical
            for implementation take-off; in this case however, this
            proved difficult because of restrictions placed on civil
            servant staff: this was the one key drawback of
            implementation arrangements, and furthermore, hampered
            predictability on the length of time such issues might be
            resolved; 4) the knowledge of, and reliability on the ODS
            market, helped build support for the refrigeration servicing
            initiatives, and, helped regulators decide which enforcement
            methods would be most appropriate. Despite an unfavorable
            macroeconomic environment, a project of this nature is worth
            pursuing, for it helped maintain the Bank's dialogue in
            the country during a period of non-lending: due to this
            situation, full support, and attention was given to the
            project by Bank management, and lead to establish good Bank
            implementation track record.

repnme.cdata!:
Belarus - Global Environment Facility Ozone
            Depleting Substances Phaseout Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the
            Ozone-Depleting Substances (ODS) Phaseout Project is to
            assist Belarus with rapidly phasing out ODS consumption in a
            manner consistent with international efforts and within
            internationally agreed timeframes. Assisting high
            consumption enterprises will enable them to make the
            transition to non-ODS materials before supplies diminish.
            The project will also provide needed technical assistance
            and institutional strengthening (in the form of equipment,
            technical support, and staff training) to an ozone office in
            the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental
            Protection. The project targets priority consumption
            phaseout activities in the refrigeration and solvent
            sectors, provides modest technical assistance at both the
            institutional and enterprise levels to facilitate
            implementation of the ODS Phaseout Country Program, and
            technology transfer for phaseout in the fire protection
            sector. It is structured as a framework project consisting
            of a series of six enterprise-specific technology conversion
            investment subprojects (involving refrigeration
            manufacturing, refrigeration servicing, solvent
            replacement), and two technical assistance sub-components
            involving fire protection technology and capacity building.
